column4: anyone any good with ffmpeg?  I just want to convert an asf file into mp3
I thought asf was a video file container
it is, but vlc will only save audio it rips from online to this format successfully
that particular approach would be fine, installing feisty which is alpha is itself risky
risky for security reasons or stability?
if you have nothing to lose then by all means go with feisty, in fact use xubuntu feisty, they need some testers desperately
it contains different things, like abiword instead of open office. It has the ubuntu repos though so you can get whatever you want.
yeah christmas and ultimate you mean
I have never tried them, I thought it was kind of odd
are they just ubuntu with other stuff preinstalled?
basically the idea is to have a media player open a music file. If you can select the media player and file and the time of day you want, I or someone else can help with the cronjob
why are you mounting a mount point
yeah pastebinning your /etc/fstab, would be a good start
